title: How to Make Chocolate Oatmeal Bars

steps.headline: Heat the chocolate chips and milk in a 1-quart heavy saucepan over low heat.
Stir frequently until the chocolate has melted and mixture is smooth.
Set the chocolate and milk mixture aside.
Spray a 8x8x2 or 9x9x2 inch square pan with cooking spray.
Mix the flour, 1/2 cup oats, baking powder, baking soda and salt together until well combined in large bowl.
Stir together the brown sugar, oil, vanilla and egg product in a medium bowl with fork until smooth.
Stir the sugar mixture into the flour mixture until blended.
Take half the dough and place evenly in the square pan.
Spread the chocolate and milk mixture evenly over the dough.
Take the other half of the dough and mix it with the butter and 2 tablespoons of oats.
Add the oat dough mixture over the chocolate mixture.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until top is golden and firm.
Allow it to cool completely for about 1 1/2 hours.

text: Making the Chocolate Mixture Heat the chocolate chips and milk in a 1-quart heavy saucepan over low heat.  Stir frequently until the chocolate has melted and mixture is smooth.  Set the chocolate and milk mixture aside.  Making the Dough Preheat the oven to 350°F.  Spray a 8x8x2 or 9x9x2 inch square pan with cooking spray.  Mix the flour, 1/2 cup oats, baking powder, baking soda and salt together until well combined in large bowl.  Set the flour mixture aside.  Stir together the brown sugar, oil, vanilla and egg product in a medium bowl with fork until smooth.  Stir the sugar mixture into the flour mixture until blended.  Take half the dough and place evenly in the square pan.  Spread the chocolate and milk mixture evenly over the dough.  Making the Oat Dough Take the other half of the dough and mix it with the butter and 2 tablespoons of oats.  Add the oat dough mixture over the chocolate mixture.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until top is golden and firm.  Allow it to cool completely for about 1 1/2 hours.  Cut the bars into 16 squares.
